definitions.definition: A cord formed by spinning or twisting together textile fibers or filaments into one or more continuous strands , typically used in needlework .
A piece of yarn , especially said of warps and wefts in a woven fabric .
Any of various natural (as spiderweb , etc.) or manufactured filaments (as glass , plastic , metal , etc.).
The line midway between the banks of a stream .
The continuing course of life ; thread of life .
An ordered course , that which connects the successive points in a discourse .

subdefinitions.definition: A line of reasoning , sequence of ideas , or train of thought .
examples: I’ve lost the thread of what you’re saying.

subdefinitions.definition: A continuing theme that modifies the whole discourse.
examples: All of these essays have a common thread .

definitions.definition: A unit of execution, lighter in weight than a process , usually sharing memory and other resources with other threads executing concurrently.
A series of posts or messages , consisting of an initial post and responses to it, generally relating to the same subject , on a newsgroup , Internet forum , or social media platform .
A precarious condition ; something that which offers no real or otherwise perceived security .
examples: a life hanging by a thread

definitions.definition: The degree of fineness ; quality ; nature .

main_definition: A cord formed by spinning or twisting together textile fibers or filaments into one or more continuous strands , typically used in needlework .
secondary_definitions: ( weaving ) A piece of yarn , especially said of warps and wefts in a woven fabric .
Any of various natural (as spiderweb , etc.) or manufactured filaments (as glass , plastic , metal , etc.).
The line midway between the banks of a stream .
The continuing course of life ; thread of life .
An ordered course , that which connects the successive points in a discourse .
( computing ) A unit of execution, lighter in weight than a process , usually sharing memory and other resources with other threads executing concurrently.
( Internet ) A series of posts or messages , consisting of an initial post and responses to it, generally relating to the same subject , on a newsgroup , Internet forum , or social media platform .
A precarious condition ; something that which offers no real or otherwise perceived security .
( figurative , obsolete ) The degree of fineness ; quality ; nature .
